p:
YFV dataset assembly - The complete polyprotein open reading frame [complete coding sequence (CDS), 10,239 nt in length] of the genome of the newly generated 2019 YFV from the Casimiro de Abreu municipality was combined with all American YFV sequences available in GenBank on January 2019 (www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/) with known dates and countries of collection, covering at least 99% of the viral CDS, and with an associated publication. The sequences were aligned using MAFFT
22 and classified into South American genotypes I and II by reconstructing a maximum likelihood (ML) phylogenetic tree with PhyML
23 , under the best substitution model selected by jModelTest v1.6.
24 Branch support was estimated with the approximate likelihood-ratio test (aLRT). Only YFV sequences classified as South American I genotype (SA-I) were retained for further analyses.
